content.description: Downhill and to the left from the meditation boulder, or downhill and right of Bolt Wall, Cat's Eye and Talent Scout lies this low boulder, unassuming in nature until one looks at the 20 foot long, 5' high overhanging west face.  Traverse along the face without using the top (two variations for finish include the standard by staying on the finishing rail, or using the slopers on the top of the rock).  Very fun power endurance, once you become very familiar reverse the problem.  Or start working the V9 but scraping low traverse.
content.protection: Other than the small boulder near the end of the problem, and the horizontal nature of some of the moves, this traverse remains within a couple feet of a soft landing the whole way.  Bring either a crash pad or a spotter make this lowball very safe, after a little work you'll feel safe without either.

content.description:
This is a crimpy and enduring traverse near the ground following the thin crack just below the normal

Punk Rock Traverse

. It has the same ending as

Punk Rock Traverse

, climbing over the lip. A crucial handhold was broken, it's V10.
content.location:
It is just below the normal

Punk Rock Traverse

.

content.description:
For this short warm-up problem, you start on the same two jugs that are used for the start of

Punk Rock Traverse

. All the holds are on the lip - you can use whatever holds you find above the lip to top out. The topout is right before the slanted crack in the middle of the boulder. A pad or a spotter is recommended for the topout as there is a rock you could fall on. Otherwise, the majority of the climb is pretty close to the ground, so if you fall, there's no real danger. This problem certainly has been climbed plenty of times before; however, it wasn't posted on mountainproject, and now it is. Enjoy!
content.location: Here are the directions listed on the last page: Follow the trail from the south end of the parking lot around the ridgeline to the Cat's Eye Face, turning left as for the Talent Scout Block, but walk past, and head northwest. The trail passes Punk Rock and reaches a fork, where you can turn sharp left (south) and reach the west face of the block.
